let's get right into the economic

graduates they're having a very
difficult time finding full-time

the youth unemployment is fifty sixty

and if they do not have the foundation
there the economy is going to fall apart

graduates who are graduating they cannot

that are in their field making the pay
they're supposed to be making after

parents and if we go back to nineteen

olds live with their parents by 2013
this number doubled and currently half
of young adults live in their parents

mean many of the states are reporting
that children are living with their
parents but they're no longer children
they're 22 23 24 25 and in states like

still living at home illinois
fifty-three percent indiana 42-percent
mississippi forty-four percent tennessee
forty-four percent and it goes on and on
and on and this is showing us that they
are not getting those high pay jobs
where they can go out and rent an
apartment get a car to get to work we're
finding that most of these youths are
being pushed down by the economic

people always hear from others saying
listen well I have a job you should have
a job you're lazy you're not really
looking for a job well let me just say
those people who have a job thank God
you do because you don't want to be in
that circumstance where you're laid off
and you're looking for one because you
will not realize how hard it is to find
another job until you lose that job and
I know a lot of people I'm one of them
who lost their job and it was a very
very difficult time finding another job
sometimes you can't find that job
sometimes you have to start something on
your own because there's just nothing
out there
and we're seeing a lot of people fall

people blame it on you you have them
fixed up your house all this always
seems to be turning back to the person
but let me just tell you it's not the

it's the economy that the central bank
created it's the illusion that everyone
is living in today because let me just
say those people who have been laid off
and there's hundreds and hundreds of
thousands of people in the last year
that have been laid off they are having
a very difficult time finding work and
people say well how do you know this
well you have to look at the

very low and we know we don't believe

a lot of them do believe that if they

what happens is time passes three months
six months nine months and they still

some of them might go take a part-time

school into college
they told you go to college you're going
